title: Ticket #4913: submit files should support if/else and include like config files
description:
The submit file parser should support the same improved syntax as config files got in the v8.2 series. if/else and include syntax.

We will get the improved behavior by having condor_submit use the config file parser to read in submit files. The config parser will have to be enhanced to support this. In particular it will need to handle the Queue statement, which right now is a syntax error to the config parser. The fix will be that lines that have no '=' or multiple words before the '=' will be handed to a callback supplied by condor_submit for parsing. this callback will parse queue statements and return -1 for all others, which will then be treated as errors.

The other thing that the config parser cannot currently parse is 

   +Attribute=value
   -Attribute=value

These will be re-written in the config parser to and then parsed as 

   MY.Attribute=value
   MY.Attribute=

Then condor_submit will iterate the submit hashtable at Queue time and shove all attributes that begin with "MY." into the job ad. One advantage of this design is that these attributes will now also be available for substitution in $(MY.Attribute).

One other advantage to having condor_submit use the config file parser is that it opens up the possibility of having a param table and metaknobs in submit files. The work to fully enable these two features will not be done until a use case for them is found.
